casebody.data:
CHARLES SINGER AND PAUL B. MOOS, APPLICANTS, v. CHARLES F. JUECHTER ET AL. Decided May 8, 1924.

Before Justices Kalisch, Black and Campbell.

For the applicant, J. Emil Walscheid. For the respondents, Robert H. McCarter. Per Curiam.

It has been consented to that the application for a peremptory writ of mandamus should be granted. The application to have the pleadings moulded so as to permit an appeal to the Court of Errors and Appeals is denied.

Let the writ of mandamus issue as prayed for.
